Classification.Classification: Actinopteri (ray-finned fishes) > Eupercaria/misc (Various families in series Eupercaria) > Sparidae (Porgies)
Classification.Etymology: Stenotomus: Greek, stenos = narrow + Greek, stoma = mouth . More on author: Linnaeus.

sectionData.Environment: Marine; demersal; oceanodromous ; depth range 15 - ? m . Subtropical; 46°N - 25°N
sectionData.Distribution: Western Atlantic: Nova Scotia in Canada to Florida in USA; rare south of North Carolina, USA.
sectionData.Biology: Occurs usually in schools inshore in summer and offshore in winter. Feeds on amphipods, worms, sand dollars and young squid . Utilized fresh, smoked and frozen; eaten pan-fried, broiled and baked . Exported to Japan
